result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery R. Lyp

records.addlTxt:
10:04 AM Defendant Jeffery R. Lyp in court without counsel. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant does not qualify for a Public Defender. Information on how to apply for a court appointed attorney given to defendant in court.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/24/22 at 2:15pm
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(11:02 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeffery R. Lyp appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Jeffery R. Lyp.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on September 12, 2022 at 2 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
